question_1.question: What is the first step to configure Power BI for deploying a semantic model according to the TimeXtender article?

options.option_d: Select the Premium per user or Premium per capacity License mode

question_1.explanation: The first step listed under 'Configure Power BI' is to login to app.powerbi.com before any other actions are taken.

question_2.question: What should you do if you receive an authentication error when first attempting to execute your model in TimeXtender?

options.option_d: Create a new semantic model instance

question_2.explanation: The article advises updating your data source credentials if you encounter an authentication error when first executing your model.

question_3.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in adding a Power BI Premium Semantic Model Endpoint?

options.option_a: Paste the Workspace Connection URL copied from the Power BI workspace.
options.option_c: Deploy & Execute the semantic instance in TimeXtender Desktop.
options.option_d: Give your endpoint a friendly name in TimeXtender.

question_3.explanation: Deploying & Executing the semantic instance is a separate step in TimeXtender Desktop, not part of adding a Power BI Premium Semantic Model Endpoint.

question_4.question: What should you take note of when creating an App Registration in Azure for use with TimeXtender?

options.option_a: The Tenant ID and App ID

question_4.explanation: When creating an App Registration in Azure, it is important to take note of the Tenant ID and App ID, as these will be used as part of your username later.
